timeline.message:
Replace "whitelist" with "allowlist" in DDR/docs

Signed-off-by: Theresa Mammarella <Theresa.T.Mammarella@ibm.com>

Replace "whitelist" with "allowlist" in DDR/docs

Signed-off-by: Theresa Mammarella <Theresa.T.Mammarella@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: @andrewcraik What's the impact of this change?  Is there any existing tooling etc that needs to be updated at the same time as this change?  I expect the debug counters have no stable external requirements
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: there are no dependencies I am aware of - these are internal and not expected stable though thanks for checking since we do sometimes build tools on top of such features.
replies.author: andrewcraik

timeline.bodyText:
I think the search / replace missed "white-listed" as I see a couple of occurrences of it in this file.
Can you put the zlib changes in a separate PR?  I want to think through the implications of modifying source that's maintained elsewhere and the impacts on our ability to consume it in the future.
Ideally, changes like this would be done upstream in the zlib project first and then consumed from there to OpenJ9
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: zlib is maintained in https://github.com/madler/zlib We should try to get these changes accepted upstream first.  If they won't accept them, we can look at maintaining this patch indefinitely
replies.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: Okay. I will create an issue there.
replies.author: theresa-m

replies.bodyText: I've removed the zlib changes from this pr.
replies.author: theresa-m
